name.value: FHIR Connectathon 14 - Patient - Formal Testing - FHIR Client - Register - Server Assigned Resource Id - XML

description.value: Patient Track - Formal Testing - tests external FHIR Client using the XML format to register (create) a Patient resource instance where the server assigns the resource id. The destination server must support the create (POST) operation, search operation and conditional delete to insure the Patient resource does not exist or is removed prior to test execution.
Patient read, update and delete operations
Enter the unique patient identifier the origin system will send to the destination system.
Enter the patient family name the origin system will send to the destination system.
Enter the patient given name the origin system will send to the destination system.
Enter the patient gender the origin system will send to the destination system.
Enter the patient birth date the origin system will send to the destination system.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure the patient does not exist on the server.
Create a new patient, no extensions where the client assigns the resource id using XML. The expected response content is the created Patient resource in XML format.
Create patient with server assigned resource id.
Confirm that the client requested an Accept of the FHIR XML format.
Confirm that the client requested a Content-Type of the FHIR XML format.
Confirm that the client request payload contains a Patient resource type.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 201(Created).
Confirm that the returned format is the FHIR XML format.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return the updated resource.
(Touchstone operation) Search for the created patient by the unique patient identifier, family and given names and validate contents.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is the FHIR XML format.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Validate that the returned resource conforms to the base FHIR Bundle profile.
Confirm that there is at least one record returned. There could be other patient records returned.
Confirm that the Bundle total value matches or is greater than the number of entries in the Bundle. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the resource version is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected retained identifier element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected retained family name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected retained given name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected retained gender element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected retained birthDate element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
